channel.title: Problem with ranging (Arrows)
channel.description: Well my base is Delta, and I tested ranging. I noticed, when I fire an arrow, that arrow doesn't appear on the ground. Is there any way I can fix this issue? Thank-you in advance.

item.title: Problem with ranging (Arrows)
item.dc:creator: @Owned_Pl0xs Owned_Pl0xs
item.description:
@Owned_Pl0xs wrote:

[quote=“Phineas, post:8, topic:324116”][quote author=Owned_Pl0xs link=topic=420520.msg3089249#msg3089249 date=1262745124]

Found this in a delta source:

public void DropArrows(int EnemyX, int EnemyY) { if(misc.random(8) == 1){ playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] --; } if(misc.random(8) >=2){ if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] != 4214 && playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] != 0) if (ItemHandler.itemAmount(playerEquipment[playerArrows], EnemyX, EnemyY) == 0) { ItemHandler.addItem(playerEquipment[playerArrows], EnemyX, EnemyY, 1, playerId, false); } else if (ItemHandler.itemAmount(playerEquipment[playerArrows], EnemyX, EnemyY) != 0) { int amount = ItemHandler.itemAmount(playerEquipment[playerArrows], EnemyX, EnemyY); ItemHandler.removeItem(playerEquipment[playerArrows], EnemyX, EnemyY, amount); ItemHandler.addItem(playerEquipment[playerArrows], EnemyX, EnemyY, amount + 1, playerId, false); } } } }

That’s all you’ll need to make it work.

Didn’t work, but thanks for trying to help :D.

You need to call the method too.

I thought he would’ve known that by now.

Anyway, to call the method, go to your attack method, or whatever the method is called for you, or just find the part where the arrow is deleted, and add this:

DropArrows(EnemyX, EnemyY);

Replace EnemyX and EnemyY with your parameters, by the way.

Lolz don’t let my rep fool you, I know nothing XD.

No, you just seemed like an intelligent young fellow.

I guess that was one of my misconceptions, although.
[/quote]
Rly :eek:, you thought I was intelligent :D. Hey thanks.[/quote]

No problem broski.

Read full topic
